intro: Daucus gingidium subsp. polygamus, commonly known as the Persian carrot, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in umbels. The plant produces a taproot that is typically white or pale yellow in color. It is native to regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
